alert.note: Alert for Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Niobrara Valley, Fort Niobrara NWR, Samuel R McKelvie National Forest; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 07 at 2:33PM CDT until September 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Red flag Warning in Effect Thursday Morning through Thursday Evening for Low Humidit, Gusty Winds, and Lightning Across Western and North Central Nebraska... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY, GUSTY WINDS, AND LIGHTNING, FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 204, 206, 208, 209, 210, AND 219... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 204 Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR, Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest, Fire Weather Zone 208 Niobrara Valley/Fort Niobrara NWR/Samuel R McKelvie National Forest, Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin, Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin and Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * TIMING...Thursday 11 AM to 8 PM CDT. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. Winds transition to northwesterly across northwest Nebraska during the afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 15 percent across western Nebraska and 15 to 20 percent for central Nebraska. * TEMPERATURES...Highs near 100. * LIGHTNING...Thunderstorm chances increase during the evening hours across northwest Nebraska, then spread to the rest of the forecast area during the night. Dry lightning is possible. * IMPACTS...Any fire start may be capable of spreading rapidly and exhibiting extreme behavior.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Niobrara Valley, Fort Niobrara NWR, Samuel R McKelvie National Forest; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
